sleep_index.title: Your Sleep Index trend over the last 3 weeks
sleep_index.description: The sleep index is designed to be one single metric you need to judge your sleep health, using several contributors like total sleep duration, resting HR, restfulness.

insights.description: Your overall sleep index has gone down compared to the previous week. Checkout which contributors to fix and how to improve them.

best_contributors.title: Sleep Efficiency
best_contributors.description: This measures the amount of time your body spends resting and repairing while you are in bed.

best_contributors.title: Restfulness
best_contributors.description: Restfulness is measured by evaluating your movement and periods of wakefulness during sleep.

worst_contributors.title: Total Sleep
worst_contributors.description: It represents the volume of uninterrupted sleep every night for your body.

insights.title: How to improve Total Sleep
insights.description: Optimum supplementation of magnesium is known to keep you asleep for longer.

worst_contributors.title: Timing
worst_contributors.description: This represents the adherence to your Circadian Rhythm.

insights.title: How to improve Consistency
insights.description: Sleep discipline begins with setting a routine. Aim to go to bed and wake up at the same time each day, even if you don't get enough sleep. This consistency helps prevent fatigue from sleep deprivation.

worst_contributors.title: HRV Form
worst_contributors.description: This metric represents the HRV trend across the duration of your sleep.

insights.title: How to improve HRV Form
insights.description: Optimizing your sleep environment can enhance your HRV Form by improving restfulness and increasing deep sleep. Try taking a warm shower, doing breathing exercises, and avoiding blue light before bed to create your ideal sleep environment.

recovery_index.title: Your Recovery Index trend over the last 3 weeks
recovery_index.description: The Recovery Score indicates your overall state of 'well-being'. It depends on markers like resting heart rate, hrv, temperature, sleep quality, movement and recovery.

insights.description: Your overall recovery index has gone down compared to the previous week. Check out which contributors to fix and how to improve them.

worst_contributors.title: Sleep Quotient
worst_contributors.description: Sleep quality and duration are factored into this metric.

insights.title: How to improve Sleep Quotient
insights.description: Enhancing your sleep environment is essential for better sleep quality. Ensure the room is at a comfortable temperature and avoid blue light exposure 2-3 hours before bedtime to promote natural melatonin production and help you fall asleep more easily.

worst_contributors.title: HRV Form
worst_contributors.description: This metric reflects your HRV patterns and variations, which indicate your body's adaptability.

insights.title: How to improve HRV Form
insights.description: Downtrending HRV beyond normal thresholds could happen due to lack of recovery or illness. To improve this prioritize rest and low intensity exercise.

worst_contributors.title: Resting Heart Rate
worst_contributors.description: Resting Heart Rate (RHR) is an indicator of your overall cardiovascular health and fitness level. A lower RHR typically signifies better cardiovascular fitness and efficient heart function, while a higher RHR can indicate stress, overtraining, dehydration, or potential health issues.

insights.title: How to improve RHR
insights.description: Sleep quality plays a major role in improving heart efficiency. On days you arenâ€™t able to get quality sleep, try a 30 min Non-sleep deep rest protocol to improve restfulness and heart efficiency.

movement_index.title: Your Movement Index trend over the last 3 weeks
movement_index.description: The Movement Index is designed to keep you moving for optimal glucose metabolism and increase your non-exercise energy usage. It's a measure of how active you were that day.

insights.description: Your overall movement index has improved compared to the previous week. Check out which all contributors you can improve further.

best_contributors.title: Workout Frequency
best_contributors.description: This metric tracks the number of days you were highly active and the number of workouts you completed, providing a long-term measure of your overall activity.
